title: 113_s1001
content: The Act titled "Iran Export Embargo Act" imposes sanctions on the government of Iran under the Iran Freedom and Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012. The Act imposes sanctions on the Government of Iran for violating human rights and sponsoring terrorism. The Government of Iran is a sponsor of terrorism, involved in attacks in Bulgaria, Washington DC, Azerbaijan, Canada, and Georgia. It violates UN Security Council Resolutions by continuing nuclear activities. The Government of Iran violates UN Security Council Resolutions by refusing to suspend proliferation-sensitive nuclear activities, developing ballistic missiles, transferring arms to terrorist groups in Lebanon and Gaza. The Government of Iran continues to support terrorist groups in southern Lebanon and the Gaza Strip, as well as the Government of Syria in committing human rights abuses and crimes against humanity in Syria. The President is required to block all transactions involving property of individuals involved in these activities. The President is mandated to block transactions involving property of individuals supporting terrorist groups in Lebanon, Gaza, and Syria. Additionally, the President must prohibit certain transactions in the United States by foreign financial institutions that have knowingly engaged in specified activities. The President is required to impose sanctions on individuals who conduct significant transactions with Iran after a specified date. Sanctions will be imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act for importing, purchasing, or transferring goods or services from Iran. The President will impose sanctions on individuals who knowingly import, purchase, or transfer goods or services from a person described in subsection (f) after a specified date. Sanctions will also be imposed on those who provide underwriting services, insurance, or reinsurance to the same individuals. The President may impose sanctions on individuals providing underwriting services or insurance to those described in subsection (f) unless due diligence is exercised in enforcing policies to prevent such activities. The President may impose sanctions on individuals providing underwriting services or insurance to persons associated with the state and Government of Iran, including the Central Bank of Iran, or acting on their behalf. The President can impose sanctions on individuals associated with the state and Government of Iran, including the Central Bank of Iran, directly or indirectly. This includes persons acting on behalf of the government or determined by the President to be described in the specified categories. Sanctions apply regardless of the person's name being published in the Federal Register or on the list of specially designated nationals and blocked persons. The President can impose sanctions on individuals associated with the state and Government of Iran, including the Central Bank of Iran. Sanctions apply regardless of the person's name being published in the Federal Register or on the list of specially designated nationals and blocked persons. Subsections (c) and (d) shall apply to the exportation, importation, sale, or transfer of crude oil from Iran 180 days after the enactment of this Act.
